caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"AddressEmptyCode(address)":[{"details":"There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract)."}],"AddressInsufficientBalance(address)":[{"details":"The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation."}],"ERC20InsufficientAllowance(address,uint256,uint256)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the `spender`\u2019s `allowance`. Used in transfers.","params":{"allowance":"Amount of tokens a `spender` is allowed to operate with.","needed":"Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.","spender":"Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner."}}],"ERC20InsufficientBalance(address,uint256,uint256)":[{"details":"Indicates an error related to the current `balance` of a `sender`. Used in transfers.","params":{"balance":"Current balance for the interacting account.","needed":"Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.","sender":"Address whose tokens are being transferred."}}],"ERC20InvalidApprover(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.","params":{"approver":"Address initiating an approval operation."}}],"ERC20InvalidReceiver(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.","params":{"receiver":"Address to which tokens are being transferred."}}],"ERC20InvalidSender(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.","params":{"sender":"Address whose tokens are being transferred."}}],"ERC20InvalidSpender(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the `spender` to be approved. Used in approvals.","params":{"spender":"Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner."}}],"FailedInnerCall()":[{"details":"A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An operation with an ERC20 token failed."}]},"events":{"Approval(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance."},"Borrowed(address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when the strategy borrows ETH for a wallet"},"KETHClaimed(address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when KETH rewards are claimed for a depositor"},"KETHDeposited(address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when KETH is deposited to the pool"},"KETHWithdrawn(address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when KETH is withdrawn from the pool"},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Slashed(address,uint256,address)":{"details":"Emitted when a slash happens"},"Transfer(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"borrow(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Borrows KETH from the pool and records the debt to      the debtor's address","params":{"amount":"The debt principal to borrow","designatedVerifier":"The designated verifier of debtor","maxSlashableAmountPerCorruption":"Maximum slashable amount per corruption","maxSlashableAmountPerLiveness":"Maximum slashable amount per liveness"}},"claimKETH()":{"details":"Claims all of the accrued KETH for msg.sender      and sends it to the msg.sender's address"},"claimKETH(address)":{"details":"Claims all of the accrued KETH for the lender      and sends it to the lender's address","params":{"lender":"Lender to claim for"}},"constructor":{"params":{"_daoAddress":"Dao address","_interestRateModel":"Address of the interest rate model","_keth":"Address of the KETH token","_maxBorrowRatio_RAY":"Maximum borrow ratio","_maxSlashableRatio_RAY":"Maximum slashable raio","_name":"Name of the pool's share ERC20","_symbol":"Symbol of the pool's share ERC20"}},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"deposit(uint256)":{"details":"Deposits KETH into the pool and mints pool shares to sender"},"depositFor(uint256,address)":{"details":"Deposits KETH into the pool and mints pool shares to sender"},"getDebtor(address)":{"details":"Returns data for a particular debtor","params":{"debtor":"Address to return the struct for"}},"getDesignatedVerifier(address)":{"details":"Returns data for a particular debtor","params":{"debtor":"Address to return the struct for"}},"getExpectedInterest(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Returns the expected interest accrued over a duration,      assuming interest rate doesn't change after the initial borrow","params":{"duration":"Expected duration of a debt position","maxSlashableAmountPerCorruption":"Maximum slashable amount per corruption","maxSlashableAmountPerLiveness":"Maximum slashable amount per liveness","principalAmount":"The debt principal to compute                        interest for"},"returns":{"_0":"Expected interest amount in KETH"}},"getLender(address)":{"details":"Returns data for a particular lender","params":{"lender":"Address to return the struct for"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"increaseDebt(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"IMPLEMENTATION: increase debt","params":{"amount":"The debt principal to borrow","designatedVerifier":"The designated verifier of debtor","maxSlashableAmountPerCorruption":"Maximum slashable amount per corruption","maxSlashableAmountPerLiveness":"Maximum slashable amount per liveness"}},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setConfigurator(address)":{"details":"Transfers the configurator role to another address"},"setDaoAddress(address)":{"details":"Sets a new DAO address"},"setMinDepositLimit(uint256)":{"details":"Sets a new deposit limit"},"setNewInterestRateModel(address)":{"details":"Sets a new interest rate calculator"},"slash(uint8,address,uint256,address)":{"details":"Slash KETH from the pool","params":{"amount":"the slash amount","debtor":"the debtor address","recipient":"the recipient address","slashType":"the slash type (liveness & corruption)"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"terminate(address)":{"details":"Terminate debt position","params":{"debtor":"the debtor address"}},"topUpSlashAmount(uint256)":{"details":"Top up slash amount","params":{"amount":"the amount"}},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"Transfers pool shares to another address","params":{"amount":"Amount of shares to transfer","to":"Address to transfer shares to"}},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Transfers pool shares from one address to another","params":{"amount":"Amount of shares to transfer","from":"Address to transfer shares from","to":"Address to transfer shares to"}},"withdraw(uint256,bool)":{"details":"Burns shares from the sender and return the equivalent fraction      of remaining KETH liquidity. Optionally, sends all KETH accrued      by the lender.","params":{"claim":"Whether to claim accrued KETH","shares":"The amount of shares to burn"}}},"stateVariables":{"CONFIGURATOR_ROLE":{"details":"Identifier for the Configurator (owner) role"},"REPORTER_ROLE":{"details":"Identifier for the Reporter role"},"STRATEGY_ROLE":{"details":"Identifier for the Strategy role"},"assumedLiquidity":{"details":"Amount of KETH liquidity that was not yet spent to acquire KETH"},"borrowDuration":{"details":"Borrow duration"},"borrowedLiquidity":{"details":"Amount of KETH liquidity currently borrowed from the pool"},"currentCumulativeKethPerShare_RAY":{"details":"Amount of KETH per single pool share, multiplied by RAY"},"daoAddress":{"details":"DAO address"},"debtPositionEnd":{"details":"Debt position end index"},"debtPositionStart":{"details":"Debt position start index"},"debtPositions":{"details":"Debt positions array"},"debtors":{"details":"Map from debtor address the their data"},"interestPerSecLU_RAY":{"details":"The latest recorded interest rate, in RAY format"},"interestRateModel":{"details":"Address of the interest rate model"},"keth":{"details":"KETH token address"},"lenders":{"details":"Map from lender address to their data"},"maxBorrowRatio_RAY":{"details":"Maximum borrow ratio"},"maxSlashableRatio_RAY":{"details":"Maximum slashable ratio"},"minDepositLimit":{"details":"Minimal size of deposit"},"timestampLU":{"details":"Timestamp of the latest interest index update"}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"borrow(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Can only be called by the strategy, since the pool         itself does not enforce repayment and only strategy         can do that. As such, the debt will be         recorded to the address of the strategy.This function changes the available liquidity,         so the index has to update beforehand. Also, the         cumulative index at debt opening is recorded,         so the index must be up to date, to correctly         compute interest for the debtor"},"claimKETH()":{"notice":"While this doesn't modify the sender's balance,         the position is updated to record         the latest reward amount beforehand"},"claimKETH(address)":{"notice":"While this doesn't modify the lender balance,         the position is updated to record         the latest reward amount beforehand"},"deposit(uint256)":{"notice":"Modifies both the lender's balance and the interest rate,         so index and lender's cumulative reward per token have         to be updated"},"depositFor(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Modifies both the lender's balance and the interest rate,         so index and lender's cumulative reward per token have         to be updated"},"setConfigurator(address)":{"notice":"Restricted to configurator only.Caution! The action is irreversible and can lead to loss         of control if the new address is wrong."},"setDaoAddress(address)":{"notice":"Restricted to configurator only"},"setMinDepositLimit(uint256)":{"notice":"Restricted to configurator only"},"setNewInterestRateModel(address)":{"notice":"Restricted to configurator only"},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"notice":"This function modifies the sender's         and the recipient's share balances,         so positions of both must be updated"},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"This function modifies the sender's         and the recipient's share balances,         so positions of both must be updated"},"withdraw(uint256,bool)":{"notice":"Modifies both the lender's balance and the interest rate,         so index and lender's cumulative reward per token have         to be approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

borrow(address,uint256,uint256,uint256).details: Borrows KETH from the pool and records the debt to      the debtor's address

claimKETH().details: Claims all of the accrued KETH for msg.sender      and sends it to the msg.sender's address

claimKETH(address).details: Claims all of the accrued KETH for the lender      and sends it to the lender's address

params._interestRateModel: Address of the interest rate model
params._name: Name of the pool's share ERC20
params._symbol: Symbol of the pool's share ERC20

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

deposit(uint256).details: Deposits KETH into the pool and mints pool shares to sender

depositFor(uint256,address).details: Deposits KETH into the pool and mints pool shares to sender

getDebtor(address).details: Returns data for a particular debtor

params.debtor: Address to return the struct for

getDesignatedVerifier(address).details: Returns data for a particular debtor

params.debtor: Address to return the struct for

getExpectedInterest(uint256,uint256,uint.details: Returns the expected interest accrued over a duration,      assuming interest rate doesn't change after the initial borrow

params.duration: Expected duration of a debt position
params.principalAmount: The debt principal to compute                        interest for

getLender(address).details: Returns data for a particular lender

params.lender: Address to return the struct for

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setConfigurator(address).details: Transfers the configurator role to another address

setNewInterestRateModel(address).details: Sets a new interest rate calculator

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Transfers pool shares to another address

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers pool shares from one address to another

withdraw(uint256,bool).details: Burns shares from the sender and return the equivalent fraction      of remaining KETH liquidity. Optionally, sends all KETH accrued      by the lender.

params.shares: The amount of shares to burn

borrow(address,uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Can only be called by the strategy, since the pool         itself does not enforce repayment and only strategy         can do that. As such, the debt will be         recorded to the address of the strategy.This function changes the available liquidity,         so the index has to update beforehand. Also, the         cumulative index at debt opening is recorded,         so the index must be up to date, to correctly         compute interest for the debtor

claimKETH().notice: While this doesn't modify the sender's balance,         the position is updated to record         the latest reward amount beforehand

claimKETH(address).notice: While this doesn't modify the lender balance,         the position is updated to record         the latest reward amount beforehand

deposit(uint256).notice: Modifies both the lender's balance and the interest rate,         so index and lender's cumulative reward per token have         to be updated

depositFor(uint256,address).notice: Modifies both the lender's balance and the interest rate,         so index and lender's cumulative reward per token have         to be updated

setConfigurator(address).notice: Restricted to configurator only.Caution! The action is irreversible and can lead to loss         of control if the new address is wrong.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: This function modifies the sender's         and the recipient's share balances,         so positions of both must be updated

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: This function modifies the sender's         and the recipient's share balances,         so positions of both must be updated

withdraw(uint256,bool).notice: Modifies both the lender's balance and the interest rate,         so index and lender's cumulative reward per token have         to be updated
